newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian gold prices rise, silver slips.
newsitem.headline: Indian gold prices rise, silver slips.

text.p: Gold prices finished higher on Thursday on the back of festival buying, but silver eased on fresh inflows, dealers said.
Modest recovery in world prices also helped gold prices, the dealers said.
Prices of a gold biscuit (116.50 gramme) settled 100 rupees higher at 60,050 per piece after rising 150 on Wednesday.
Traders said about 1,500/2,000 kg of imported silver arrived on Thursday depressing prices.
The bullion market will be closed on Friday for a Hindu festival.
